trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Adobe EchoSign | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Adobe EchoSign | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Adobe EchoSign with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Adobe EchoSign with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Adobe EchoSign.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Adobe EchoSign.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: An Adobe EchoSign single sign on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: An Adobe EchoSign single sign on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Adobe EchoSign will be able to single sign into the application at your Adobe EchoSign company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Adobe EchoSign will be able to single sign into the application at your Adobe EchoSign company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Adobe EchoSign
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Adobe EchoSign

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Adobe EchoSign.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Adobe EchoSign.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Adobe EchoSign.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Adobe EchoSign.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Adobe EchoSign, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Adobe EchoSign, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Adobe EchoSign</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Adobe EchoSign</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Adobe EchoSign with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Adobe EchoSign with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Adobe EchoSign application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Adobe EchoSign application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Adobe EchoSign page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Adobe EchoSign page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Adobe EchoSign Sign On URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://company.echosign.com/", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Adobe EchoSign Sign On URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "https://company.echosign.com/", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Adobe EchoSign page, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Adobe EchoSign page, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Adobe EchoSign company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Adobe EchoSign company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click Account, and then, in the navigation pane on the left die, click SAML Settings under Account Settings.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click Account, and then, in the navigation pane on the left die, click SAML Settings under Account Settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Account</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Account</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the SAML Settings section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the SAML Settings section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAML Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAML Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: As SAML Mode, select SAML Mandatory.
trans-unit.target: As SAML Mode, select SAML Mandatory.

trans-unit.source: Select Allow EchoSign Account Administrators to log in using their EchoSign Credentials.
trans-unit.target: Select Allow EchoSign Account Administrators to log in using their EchoSign Credentials.

trans-unit.source: As User Creation, select Automatically add users authenticated through SAML.
trans-unit.target: As User Creation, select Automatically add users authenticated through SAML.

trans-unit.source: Move on, performing the following steps:
trans-unit.target: Move on, performing the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAML Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAML Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Adobe EchoSign dialog page, copy the Entity ID value, and then paste it into the IdP Entity ID textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Adobe EchoSign dialog page, copy the Entity ID value, and then paste it into the IdP Entity ID textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Adobe EchoSign dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the IdP Login URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Adobe EchoSign dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the IdP Login URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Adobe EchoSign dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the IdP Logout URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Adobe EchoSign dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the IdP Logout URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the IdP Certificate textbox
trans-unit.target: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the IdP Certificate textbox

trans-unit.source: Click Save Changes.
trans-unit.target: Click Save Changes.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Adobe EchoSign, they must be provisioned into Adobe EchoSign.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Adobe EchoSign, they must be provisioned into Adobe EchoSign.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Adobe EchoSign, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Adobe EchoSign, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Adobe EchoSign company site as administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Adobe EchoSign company site as administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click Account, and then, in the navigation pane on the left die, click Users & Groups, and then, click Create a new user.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click Account, and then, in the navigation pane on the left die, click Users & Groups, and then, click Create a new user.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Account</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Account</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Create New User section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Create New User section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Type the Email Address, First Name and Last Name of a valid AAD account you want to provision into the related textboxes.
trans-unit.target: Type the Email Address, First Name and Last Name of a valid AAD account you want to provision into the related textboxes.

trans-unit.source: Click Create User.
trans-unit.target: Click Create User.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Active Directory account holder will receive an email that includes a link to confirm the account before it becomes active.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Active Directory account holder will receive an email that includes a link to confirm the account before it becomes active.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Adobe EchoSign user account creation tools or APIs provided by Adobe EchoSign to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Adobe EchoSign user account creation tools or APIs provided by Adobe EchoSign to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Adobe EchoSign **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Adobe EchoSign **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
